summary: ON 12/24/02   I WAS REAR-ENDED BY A DODGE NEON  TRAVELING ABOUT 25-30 MPH.  I WAS STOPPED AT A RED LIGHT AT THE TIME.  MY CAR HONDA [VIN [XXX]] WAS TOTALED.  DURING THE CRASH THE FRONT DRIVER SEAT FAILED.  THE RESULT WAS I WAS THROWN FORWARD INTO THE STEERING COLUMN WITH GREAT FORCE.  I SUFFERED MULTIPLE INJURIES BUT IN PARTICULAR I BROKE THREE RIBS ON THE LOWER RIGHT SIDE OF MY RIB CAGE .   THERE IS NO QUESTION BUT THAT THE BROKEN SEAT CONTRIBUTED TO MY INJURIES.  IT IS MY PRACTICE TO  ALWAYS WEAR A SEAT BELT.   BROKEN SEAT = BROKEN RIBS + CHEST TRAUMA ????    INFORMATION REDACTED PURSUANT TO THE FREEDOM OF INFORMATION ACT (FOIA), 5 U.S.C. 552(B)(6).  *TR
